thread.title: Maureen O'Hara, spirited movie star, dies at 95

title: Maureen O'Hara, spirited movie star, dies at 95
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Maureen O'Hara, spirited movie star, dies at 95 Actress Maureen O'Hara, the Irish beauty who appeared in such classic films as "The Quiet Man" and "How Green Was My Valley," has died. Post to Facebook Maureen O'Hara, spirited movie star, dies at 95 Actress Maureen O'Hara, the Irish beauty who appeared in such classic films as "The Quiet Man" and "How Green Was My Valley," has died.  //on.11alive.com/1LUBJEz   Join the Conversation To   Maureen O'Hara, spirited movie star, dies at 95 2:44 p.m. EDT October 24, 2015 Actor Maureen O'Hara photographed in her front yard in Los Angeles in 1960. O'Hara, known for such classics as "The Quiet Man" and "How Green Was My Valley," has died. Her manager says O'Hara died in her sleep Oct. 24, 2015, at her home in Boise, Idaho. Harold Filan, AP Maureen O'Hara arrives at the 6th annual Governors Awards at the Hollywood and Highland Center in Los Angeles in 2014. Chris Pizzello, Invision via AP Maureen O'Hara and John Wayne converse over a rocky wall in this scene from the film "The Quiet Man," which was shot on location in 1951 at the west Ireland village of Cong. AP file photo Maureen O'Hara signs autographs for school children in Moab, Utah, while filming there in 1950. Frank Filan, AP John Wayne gives Maureen O'Hara a spanking in the film 'McLintock!' in 1963. Archive Photos via Getty Images O'Hara starred in the 1941 Oscar winner 'How Green Was My Valley,' along with 'The Hunchback of Notre Dame.' DAMIAN DOVARGANES, AP Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay LOS ANGELES - MARCH 9: Actress Maureen O'Hara poses backstage during the 9th Annual Screen Actors Guild Awards at the Shrine Auditorium on March 9, 2003 in Los Angeles, California. (Photo by Frederick M. Brown/Getty Images) (Photo: Frederick M. Brown/Getty Images) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
BEVERLY HILLS, Calif. (AP) -- Actress Maureen O'Hara, the Irish beauty who appeared in such classic films as "The Quiet Man" and "How Green Was My Valley," has died. 
Her manager, Johnny Nicoletti, says O'Hara died in her sleep Saturday at her home in Boise, Idaho. She was 95. 
O'Hara came to Hollywood to star in 1939's "The Hunchback of Notre Dame" and went on to a long career. "How Green Was My Valley," a touching 1941 drama about a Welsh mining family, won five Oscars including best picture. 
She became John Wayne's favorite leading lady, appearing with him in "The Quiet Man" and other films. And she was little Natalie Wood's mother in the Christmas classic "Miracle on 34th Street." 
She's survived by a daughter in Ireland. 
(Copyright 2015 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.)
